# Introduction

@fama1973risk : Two-parameter risk-return regression equation is based in 

```{=tex}
\begin{align}
    &x_{im}  \equiv \frac{\text{total market value of all units of assets} \ i}{\text{total market value of all assets}} \\
    &\text{where asset} (i) \text{in the portfolio} (m) \nonumber
\end{align}
\label{Equation:BlackScholes1972}
```
Equation \ref{Equation:BlackScholes1972} refers to the market equilibrium (market portflio) is always efficient (@black1972capital).

Excepted Return is given by Equation \ref{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953}, $\beta_i$ is the risk of the asset $i$ of the portfolio $m$, measured relative to $\sigma^{2}(\tilde{R}_m)$


```{=tex}
\begin{align}
    &E(\tilde{R_i}) = \left[E(\tilde{R_m}) -S_m \sigma(\tilde{R_m} ) \right] + S_m \sigma (\tilde{R_m}) \beta_i,\\
    &\text{where}, \\ \nonumber
    &\beta_i \equiv \frac{cov(\tilde{R_i}, \tilde{R_m})}{\sigma^2(\tilde{R_m})} = \frac{\sigma_{j=1}^{N} x_{jm}\sigma_{ij}}{\sigma^2 (\tilde{R_m})}=\frac{cov(\tilde{R_i},\tilde{R_m})\sigma(\tilde{R_m})}{\sigma (\tilde{R_m})} \nonumber
\end{align}
\label{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953}
```
